questions.text: What is the value of sin 45°?
If tan θ = 1, find θ (where 0° < θ < 90°).
questions.explanation:
tan θ = 1
From standard angle table:
tan 45° = 1
Therefore, θ = 45°

This is a fundamental trigonometric identity:
sin²θ + cos²θ = 1

This is true for all values of θ.

questions.text: If sin θ = 3/5, find cosec θ.
What is the value of sin(90° - 30°)?
questions.explanation:
sin(90° - 30°) = sin 60°
From standard table: sin 60° = √3/2

Alternatively, using complementary angle formula:
sin(90° - θ) = cos θ
sin(90° - 30°) = cos 30° = √3/2

questions.text: If cos θ = 4/5, find sin θ (assuming θ is acute).
questions.explanation:
Using sin²θ + cos²θ = 1:
sin²θ = 1 - cos²θ
sin²θ = 1 - (4/5)²
sin²θ = 1 - 16/25
sin²θ = 9/25
sin θ = 3/5 (positive since θ is acute)

This is the 3-4-5 Pythagorean triplet.

questions.text: Find tan θ if sin θ = 1/2 and cos θ = √3/2.
questions.explanation:
tan θ = sin θ / cos θ
= (1/2) / (√3/2)
= (1/2) × (2/√3)
= 1/√3

Note: These are values for θ = 30°

This is a fundamental identity:
1 + tan²θ = sec²θ

This can be derived from sin²θ + cos²θ = 1 by dividing throughout by cos²θ.

questions.text: What is the value of tan 60°?
Find the value of: 2 sin 30° cos 30°
questions.explanation:
sin 30° = 1/2
cos 30° = √3/2

2 sin 30° cos 30°
= 2 × (1/2) × (√3/2)
= √3/2

Alternatively, using formula:
2 sin θ cos θ = sin 2θ
2 sin 30° cos 30° = sin 60° = √3/2

questions.text: A person standing 20 m away from a tower observes its top at an angle of elevation of 45°. Find the height of the tower.
questions.explanation:
Let height = h
tan 45° = h / 20
1 = h / 20 (since tan 45° = 1)
h = 20 m

When angle of elevation is 45°, height equals distance.

questions.text: Find the value of: sin 0° + cos 0°
If tan θ = 3/4, find sec θ (assuming θ is acute).
questions.explanation:
Using identity: 1 + tan²θ = sec²θ

sec²θ = 1 + (3/4)²
sec²θ = 1 + 9/16
sec²θ = 25/16
sec θ = 5/4 (positive since θ is acute)

This is from the 3-4-5 Pythagorean triplet.

questions.text: What is the maximum value of sin θ?
questions.explanation:
The sine function varies between -1 and 1.

Maximum value of sin θ = 1 (occurs at θ = 90°)
Minimum value of sin θ = -1 (occurs at θ = 270°)
